cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles NNE of Tiburon, Haiti and 90 miles S of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north-northwest then northwest, paralleling the Florida east coast and tracking toward the Georgia–South Carolina coastline before curving just offshore of the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South Carolina between Savannah, GA and Myrtle Beach, SC (near Charleston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect Deerfield Beach FL to Volusia/Brevard county line; Tropical Storm Watch Seven Mile Bridge FL to south of Deerfield Beach including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Haiti, eastern Cuba, and all of the Bahamas; Tropical Storm Warning for portions of Dominican Republic and Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida Keys through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (39–73 mph) are 42 % likely; low but present (16 %) chance of 50-kt (58 mph) sustained winds at the port late Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for 3–6 ft or higher surge along the Charleston harbor as the hurricane parallels/approaches the coast late Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches of rainfall possible with locally higher amounts, producing freshwater flooding in low-lying terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, large breaking waves in the harbor entrance, rip currents, and possible river/coastal flooding impeding ground transport to the port.
